mlr3torch 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    Context for Torch Learner

    mlr_context_torch.Rd

    Context for training a torch learner. This is the - mostly read-only - information callbacks have access to through the argument ctx. For more information on callbacks, see CallbackTorch.

    Format

    R6Class inheriting from Context.

    Construction

    ContextTorch$new(learner, task_train, task_valid = NULL, loader_train, loader_valid = NULL, measures_train = NULL, measures_valid = NULL, network, optimizer, loss_fn, total_epochs)

    • learner :: Learner
      The torch learner.

    • task_train :: Task
      The training task.

    • task_valid :: Task
      The validation task. Default is NULL.

    • loader_train :: torch::dataloader The data loader for training.

    • loader_valid :: torch::dataloader The data loader for validation.

    • measures_train :: list() of Measures
      Measures used for training. Default is NULL.

    • measures_valid :: list() of Measures
      Measures used for validation. Default is NULL.

    • network :: torch::nn_module
      The torch network.

    • optimizer :: torch::optimizer
      The optimizer.

    • loss_fn :: torch::nn_module
      The loss function.

    • total_epochs :: integer(1)
      The total number of epochs the learner is trained for.

    Fields

    All objects configured in the initialization, as well as:

    • last_scores_train :: named list()
      The scores from the last training batch. Names are the ids of the training measures.

    • last_scores_valid :: named list()
      The scores from the last validation batch. Names are the ids of the validation measures.

    • epoch :: integer(1)
      The current epoch. The current epoch.

    • batch :: list() of torch::torch_tensor
      The current iteration of the batch.

    Methods

    There are no methods.

    See also

    Other callback: as_torch_callbacks(), as_torch_callback(), callback_torch(), mlr3torch_callbacks.progress, mlr3torch_callbacks, mlr_callbacks_torch, torch_callback()
